channel.title: Do you need to portforward on VPS?
channel.description:
I just bought a VPS from vpsland.com, and I'm having a little trouble getting my server up and running. I'm able to connect remotely to the VPS desktop, and i downloaded JRE and JDK, set my EV's, and downloaded my source. I run the server, and it says its online, but when I try to connect from my regular desktop It says error connecting to server. I figured that meant I needed to portforward, but I have no idea how to portforward on a VPS since I have no idea what router is used..
Does anyone know of how to do this, or of an alternate way to host a server on a VPS if there is one?

item.title: Do you need to portforward on VPS?
item.dc:creator: @elitepvper elitepvper
item.description:
@elitepvper wrote:

You don’t portforward on a vps. Simple. If it doesn’t work though, try to disable windows firewall or any antivirus

Read full topic
item.source: Do you need to portforward on VPS?

item.title: Do you need to portforward on VPS?

item.description:
@David_Shift wrote:

You probably didn’t use the right IP.

Last time I got a VPS from that place, I didn’t need to portforward.
